Name: Orthography
Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Description: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Learning Objective: Phonemic isolation _ ability to recognize individual sounds in words/non words

Name: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Description: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Learning Objective: Phoneme identity _ ability to recognize the common sound in different words/non words
Examples: Rhyming (last sound); Same first sound in peach and pile? - "p", __ (mara) , __ (maga) - _(ma)

Name: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Description: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Learning Objective: Phoneme categorization _ ability to recognize the word with an odd sound among a sequence of three to four words/non words
Examples: Which word does not belong? bug, rug, bun, bat, __ (chala), __(gana) , __(gaja) , __(gara)

Name: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Description: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Learning Objective: Phoneme blending - ability to listen to individual sounds and to combine them into a recognizable word/non word

Name: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Description: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Learning Objective: Phoneme segmentation _ ability to break a word/non word into it sounds by tapping or counting the sounds
Examples: How many phonemes are in rain - 3, ______ (bigidu) - 6

Name: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Description: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Learning Objective: Phoneme deletion _ ability to recognize what word/non word remains when a specified phoneme is removed
Examples: What is stall without the "s" - tall, ______(nunnupu) - "_"(u) - _____(nanupu); s in snera - nera; i in mushti - musht

Name: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Description: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
Learning Objective: Phoneme substitution- Substitute first or last sound
Examples: Intial substitution: kruya with /s/ to sru-ya; final substitution: swari with /u/ to become swaru

Name: Phonemic awareness - Recognize and manipulate phonemes (Individual sounds). In "chari" (____ - __ / __), phonemes are "ch" (_), "a"(_), "r"(_), "i"(_)
